A teen-aged girl gets the horse of her dreams and is trained by an ex-Jockey to participate in London's Grand National Steeplechase. In post- colonial London, she faces racism, sexism, and D-day celebrations – the intersection of class, racial, and gender lines are examined through her adventure.

This is, without a doubt, one of my favorite Columbo episodes ever. Leland follows the story of Leland P. Fitzgerald (Ryan Gosling), a disaffected teenager who has apparently murdered a severely retarded peer, the brother of popular high school student Allison Hargrove (Jodi Lyn O'Keefe). After being sent to a youth treatment facility, Leland begins a friendship with Marybeth Fitzgerald (Michelle Williams), with whom he discusses his passion for world history, specifically the Soviet Union. Stan Laurel regarded PUTTING PANTS ON PHILIP as the first true' L&H film. Pierce Brosnan has sipped his last Martini and returns, in an outrageous self-parody, as the aging foul-mouthed boozy assassin Julian — a successor to Jack Ryan and Jason Bourne.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, the film depicts his adolescence in the country, which he spent intensively reading books, and his young adulthood in Chicago, which proved to be a formative experience.
